member.name: T:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1
member.summary: This class efficiently stores and retrieves arbitrarily sized and positioned objects in a quad-tree data structure. This can be used to do efficient hit detection or visiblility checks on objects in a virtualized canvas. The object does not need to implement any special interface because the Rect Bounds of those objects is handled as a separate argument to Insert.

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Insert(`0,System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Insert a node with given bounds into this QuadTree.

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.GetNodesInside(System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Get a list of the nodes that intersect the given bounds.
member.returns: List of zero or mode nodes found inside the given bounds

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.HasNodesInside(System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Get a list of the nodes that intersect the given bounds.
member.returns: List of zero or mode nodes found inside the given bounds

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.GetNodes(System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Get list of nodes that intersect the given bounds.
member.returns: The list of nodes intersecting the given bounds

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Remove the given node from this QuadTree.
member.returns: True if the node was found and removed.

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.ReIndex
member.summary: Rebuild all the Quadrants according to the current QuadTree Bounds.

member.name: P:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Bounds
member.summary: This determines the overall quad-tree indexing strategy, changing this bounds is expensive since it has to re-divide the entire thing - like a re-hash operation.

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.QuadNode.#ctor(`0,System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Construct new QuadNode to wrap the given node with given bounds

member.name: P:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.QuadNode.Node
member.summary: The node

member.name: P:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.QuadNode.Bounds
member.summary: The Rect bounds of the node

member.name: P:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.QuadNode.Next
member.summary: QuadNodes form a linked list in the Quadrant.

member.name: T:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Quadrant
member.summary: The canvas is split up into four Quadrants and objects are stored in the quadrant that contains them and each quadrant is split up into four child Quadrants recurrsively. Objects that overlap more than one quadrant are stored in the _nodes list for this Quadrant.

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Quadrant.#ctor(GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree{`0}.Quadrant,System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Construct new Quadrant with a given bounds all nodes stored inside this quadrant will fit inside this bounds.

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Quadrant.Insert(`0,System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Insert the given node

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Quadrant.GetIntersectingNodes(System.Collections.Generic.List{GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree{`0}.QuadNode},System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Returns all nodes in this quadrant that intersect the given bounds. The nodes are returned in pretty much random order as far as the caller is concerned.
member.param: List of nodes found in the given bounds
The bounds that contains the nodes you want returned

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Quadrant.GetIntersectingNodes(GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree{`0}.QuadNode,System.Collections.Generic.List{GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree{`0}.QuadNode},System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Walk the given linked list of QuadNodes and check them against the given bounds. Add all nodes that intersect the bounds in to the list.
member.param: The last QuadNode in a circularly linked list
The resulting nodes are added to this list
The bounds to test against each node

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Quadrant.HasIntersectingNodes(System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Return true if there are any nodes in this Quadrant that intersect the given bounds.

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Quadrant.HasIntersectingNodes(GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree{`0}.QuadNode,System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Walk the given linked list and test each node against the given bounds/
member.param: The last node in the circularly linked list.
member.returns: Return true if a node in the list intersects the bounds

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Quadrant.RemoveNode(`0)
member.summary: Remove the given node from this Quadrant.
member.returns: Returns true if the node was found and removed.

member.name: P:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Quadrant.Parent
member.summary: The parent Quadrant or null if this is the root

member.name: P:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.QuadTree`1.Quadrant.Bounds
member.summary: The bounds of this quadrant

member.summary: Set current time as the start time.

member.summary: Set the current time as the end time.

member.summary: Get the time in milliseconds between Start() and Stop().

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.PerfTimer.GetMilliseconds(System.Int64)
member.summary: Convert the given argument from "ticks" to milliseconds.
member.param: Number of ticks returned from GetTicks()

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.PerfTimer.GetDurationInTicks
member.summary: Get the time between Start() and Stop() in the highest fidelity possible as defined by Windows QueryPerformanceFrequency. Usually this is nanoseconds.

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.PerfTimer.GetCurrentTime
member.summary: Get current time in ighest fidelity possible as defined by Windows QueryPerformanceCounter. Usually this is nanoseconds.

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.PerfTimer.Count(System.Int64)
member.summary: Add the given time to a running total so we can compute minimum, maximum and average.

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.PerfTimer.Minimum
member.summary: Return the minimum time recorded by the Count() method since the last Clear

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.PerfTimer.Max
member.summary: Return the maximum time recorded by the Count() method since the last Clear

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.PerfTimer.Median
member.summary: Return the median of the values recorded by the Count() method since the last Clear

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.PerfTimer.PercentError
member.summary: Return the variance in the numbers recorded by the Count() method since the last Clear

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.PerfTimer.Average
member.summary: Return the avergae of the values recorded by the Count() method since the last Clear

member.name: M:GMap.NET.WindowsPresentation.PerfTimer.Clear
member.summary: Reset the timer to its initial state.
